result.execSummary:
The defendant Billie Lee Tatum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharges  to be paid from bail on deposit or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.

Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  NO Huber privileges. FORTHWITH.  Court will grant release privileges for work if defendant shows proof of additional payment on the municipal ticket.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Billie Lee Tatum

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  FIVE MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  NO Huber privileges. FORTHWITH.  Court will grant release privileges for work if defendant shows proof of additional payment on the municipal ticket. 

Fine of $500.00 including all mandatory  costs, fees and surcharges  to be paid from bail on deposit or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial on 2-17-16 at 8:30 and  jury trial in Branch 47  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status ON COUNSEL   in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 09-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court orders jury trial vacate.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch  47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 06-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms and Absolute Sobriety.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Billie Lee Tatum in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47  for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/31/15 @ 1:30 pm
